Closed on public holidays
Monday to Thursday: 9am - 6pm
Friday: 9am - 7pm
Saturday and Sunday: 10am - 3pm
Library facilities and services:
Books, magazines, newspapers, eBooks and digital resources,Information and Reference Services
Internet lounge - 38 computers with internet access,Wireless access to the internet is available for customers with laptops or other devices,Access points have been installed on each level of the Brisbane Square Library
Checkin - returned loans will be checked in and sorted by the most advanced booksorter technology in Australia
News lounge - read local and international newspapers and watch live news broadcasts and stock report feeds on-screen
Community Languages and Literacy Collection
Community meeting rooms and study rooms - available for booking by customers
Children's lounge - promote reading with children's story time and events
Learning lounge - provide computer training for up to 18 customers in a formal or self-paced learning environment
City Zoo - tune into the latest sporting event and other popular information. City Zoo also contains the young adult collection and X-Boxes. Bring your lunch or coffee, and check out the latest sports news on the big screen
Sound and vision lounge -which provides access to DVD/video viewing pods, listening posts and an expanded audio-visual collection
Magazine lounge - with a wide range of materials and comfortable lounge style seating with views across Reddacliff Place to the Treasury Building and Queen Street Mall
Literature lounge - a venue for good reading and author events with views across Reddacliff Square and the Brisbane River
Brisbane history gallery - learn about Brisbane's past and present
Large print collection, reference collection and non-fiction, adult fiction and biographies - with comfortable seating for quiet reading
Photocopier
Wheelchair Accessible
Customer Service Counter - make Council payments such as rates, parking infringements and library fees
Central Business Centre incorporating mapping services and Town Planners - to get information and applications for development, permits and licensing; customised Brisbane maps and lost property
Express self-service kiosks - pay Council bills by credit card or access information on rates, waste and animals
Development lounge - a meeting space for Development Assessment staff and clients
Meeting Room Information:
Brisbane Square Library hosts three meeting room spaces and 6 study spaces, in a modern and architecturally designed space. The library is centrally located, and close to all forms of public amenities.
The Brisbane Square Library meeting rooms are available for use at the following times.
 Community Meeting Room
Monday-Thursday 9am-5.45pm; Friday 9am-6.45pm; Saturday-Sunday 10am-2.45pm
Tiered Theatrette
Monday-Sunday 9am-9pm
The End Room
Monday-Thursday 9am-5.45pm; Friday 9am-6.45pm; Saturday-Sunday 10am-2.45pm
 Study Room (6 Rooms) Monday-Thursday 9am-5.45pm; Friday 9am-6.45pm; Saturday-Sunday 10am-2.45pm
*Study Rooms can be booked for a maximum of 2 hours per day
There are four study rooms. Capacity: 4. Powerpoints available. Bookings required - a 2 hour sessions can be booked.
Capacity: Community Meeting Room 20 people, Tiered Theatrette  50 people, End Room  150 people, 
Study Rooms Level 1 : 4 people, Study Rooms Level 2: 3 people

Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens, Mt Coot-tha Rd, Toowong 4066
Opening hours:
Closed on public holidays
Monday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday: 10am - 3pm
Tuesday to Thursday: 10am - 4pm
Library facilities and services:
Special Collections
      -The collection at the Mt Coot-tha Library specialises in botany, horticulture/gardening and landscape design. Other subject areas included in the collection are astronomy, botanic illustration, conservation, floral art, herbal medicine and natural history. It contains an excellent reference collection with world class literature on the subjects collected, particularly in botany. The collection is valuable to researchers in this field.
